bauhaus.title: Lessons from the Bauhaus
paragraphs: Over the years, I've presented variations of this talk to my teams, drawing inspiration from the Bauhaus and its related design movements. The talk outlines a framework for interpreting modern UI trends and applies principles and lessons from the Bauhaus to the creation of scalable, cohesive UI design systems.

Bauhäusler — a student of the Bauhaus

covidAppointments.title: COVID Appointment Notifications
covidAppointments.image: Banner graphic with Twilio's logo and three lines pointing towards the logo. The title reads Get COVID-19 Vaccine Notifications using Twilio Serverless Functions.
paragraphs: This project was an automated notification system that integrated Airtable and Twilio to call you when COVID-19 vaccine appointments became available. At the time, I wrote integrations with systems in California, Massachusetts, and New York City, as well as GetMyVaccine which aggregated vaccine availabilities from CVS, Rite-Aid, and Walgreens.

covidMyturn.title: COVID MyTurn CA Monitor
paragraphs: This project was built to collect and aggregate vaccine availability data from the CA state vaccination system (MyTurn), covering all 58 counties.

Using CloudWatch, I scheduled a cron-triggered fan-out of serverless Lambda jobs to collect availability data from MyTurn in parallel. A separate Lambda function aggregated the results and stored them in S3 as a single canonical dataset.
This was an optimization to <notifier>Vaccine Appointment Notifications</notifier> to reduce direct calls to MyTurn and to enable other projects.

homekitMagnepan.title: HomeKit Automation for Magnepans
paragraphs: This is a walkthrough of how I set up my Magnepans so that both vinyl and streaming playback are controlled through Apple HomeKit and iOS shortcuts.
- Schiit Saga+ w/ Linlai E-6SN7 tube (preamp)
- Rega P6 turntable w/ ND7 MM cartridge
- Blue Jeans Cable Ten White 10AWG speaker cables

Everything in the setup revolves around the Sonos Port's 12V trigger output which is connected to the Panamax power conditioner via a 3.5mm mono trigger cable. When the Sonos Port is actively playing music, the Panamax will wake up and turn on the entire audio stack (preamps, amplifier, subwoofer, etc.)
We can use HomeKit automations to turn the system on and off by playing (or stopping) an ambient soundtrack on the Sonos Port.
The iOS shortcuts we'll configure are:
- HomeKit Shortcuts: Turn On Magnepan, Turn Off Magnepan
- Switchbot Shortcuts: Volume Up, Volume Down, Mute, Next Source
Create a new scene that plays audio to the Sonos Port Speaker (named Magnepan here).
Choose Play Audio and then select a sound. I use Apple Ambient Sounds like Ocean since it will loop indefinitely.

With the Switchbot Hub, you can teach it IR signals from your existing remote to replay on demand. I copied the signals from the Schiit Saga's remote so the hub can control source selection and volume.
Configure the Switchbot Hub Remote and teach it the IR signals from your preamp's remote control.
Configure Quick Scenes in the Switchbot app. Have a separate scene for both Volume Up and Down that performs an action via the Switchbot remote.
Once you have the quick scene set up, add the quick scene to Siri Shortcuts (click on More ways to trigger and select Siri Shortcuts).
Once you submit it via the Switchbot app, open the iOS Shortcuts app and you'll see a shortcut created under All Shortcuts ('Volume down' in this case).
Vinyl playback doesn't inherently wake the system up. Even during vinyl playback, the Sonos Port is intentionally kept awake with an ambient looping track:
- iOS shortcut starts an ambient looping track on the Sonos Port
- This wakes up the Sonos Port, which emits a signal over 12V trigger cable to Panamax
- All analog gear powers up automatically
- Saga+ is switched to phono input
→ HomeKit automation plays Apple built-in Ambient Sounds to the Sonos Port 'Speaker'
→ 12V trigger wakes up Panamax power conditioner which turns on entire system
→ Saga+ Preamp (set to phono input—the ambient audio from Sonos keeps the system awake but isn't heard)

Digital playback is straightforward: start music on the Sonos Port via AirPlay or the Sonos app, and the 12V trigger powers on the system automatically. As long as the Saga+ is set to the DAC input, music streams to the speakers.
→ Sonos Port 'Speaker' is actively playing music from digital streaming platforms
→ 12V trigger wakes up Panamax power conditioner which turns on entire system

With this setup, I can turn on and control the system with iOS Shortcuts. Since the Sonos Port only emits a signal over the 12V DC trigger to the Power Conditioner while audio is playing, the system will automatically shut off after a short delay once audio playback stops. That's it!
P.S. Check out my record collection on <discogs>Discogs</discogs>!

home.title: Devin Nguyen
home.intro: I'm a full-stack software engineer based in New York City, currently building the intelligent automation platform for healthcare operations at <tennr>Tennr</tennr>.
home.previously: Previously, I was a Principal Software Engineer at <aidkit>AidKit</aidkit>, where I built infrastructure for governments and nonprofits to modernize and scale benefits delivery, and at <hypr>HYPR</hypr>, where I built passwordless authentication solutions for financial institutions and startups.
home.before: Before that, I was a Senior Member of Technical Staff at <cloudhealth>CloudHealth</cloudhealth> by <vmware>VMware</vmware>, building solutions for cloud governance, cost optimization, and compliance at enterprise scale.

links.ca_wildfire_mcp: MCP: Mapping LA Wildfires with AI

laMainOuverte.title: La Main Ouverte
laMainOuverte.icon: La Main Ouverte symbol in the shape of an open hand
paragraphs: Located just a few hours north of New Delhi, Chandigarh is a planned city born from an unusual collaboration with an ambitious spirit following India's independence. After the partition of India in 1947, the Punjab province of British India was split between India and Pakistan. Jawaharlal Nehru, India's first Prime Minister, embarked on a joint effort with Le Corbusier to build a utopian city that would act as a shared capital of Punjab and Haryana. It's a modern, Brutalist paradise that was completed in the 1960s and was meant to set the stage for a radical new beginning for India and was one of Le Corbusier's seminal works in architecture.
The Open Hand, or La Main Ouverte, was a recurring motif throughout Le Corbusier's work and became the defining symbol of Chandigarh.
laMainOuverte.pullquote: "It turns with the wind, not aimlessly, but to express what life really is: constant change. The hand is open to give and receive. It's a sign of optimism in this world of catastrophe."
laMainOuverte.imageAlt: Photograph {number} from La Main Ouverte architecture series

mcpWildfire.title: MCP: Mapping LA Wildfires with AI
mcpWildfire.image: Diagram showing layers of a map with a description of each layer (from bottom to top): Base map of Los Angeles, Evacuation Zone, Active Fire Zone, Damage Assessment, and Damage Photographs
paragraphs: In response to the January 2025 wildfires in Los Angeles, <aidkit>AidKit</aidkit> partnered with Los Angeles County and the City of Los Angeles to rapidly launch two emergency cash relief programs.

I led the design and implementation of the platform's new geospatial capabilities for disaster response. This included building a sync pipeline that ingested and normalized data from remote tax parcel datasets and CAL FIRE damage inspection data, storing it in PostGIS for spatial queries. We used this data to automatically triage applicants based on parcel-level impact, reducing manual review and speeding up aid delivery.

I also built real-time, interactive maps to give stakeholders live visibility into program reach and eligibility coverage. These programs ultimately distributed over $25M in direct aid to individuals and small businesses across Los Angeles.

This project inspired me to explore how AI and MCP servers can accelerate program administration. For example, we could connect an LLM to CAL FIRE's damage data to enable a wider range of automated triage and eligibility workflows.
